This section is for information only. There is nothing for you to complete.



Mastectomy
  • A mastectomy removes the entire breast containing the tumor.
  • There are different mastectomy types; skin sparing, which conserves most of the breast skin, and nipple-sparing, which also preserves the nipple and areola.
  • The type of mastectomy you undergo depends on your cancer stage, location, medical history, among other factors.
  • You may have to stay overnight in the hospital and require general anesthesia.
  • Possible risks include:
    • Collection of fluid under the skin
    • Infection
    • Loss of the nipple or skin flap tissue due to poor wound healing
    • Pain
    • Arm or shoulder stiffness
    • Depression or sadness
  • You may have surgical drains after your surgery, to prevent blood and fluid from building up under your skin.
